Definition: In this task, you are given two phrases: Head and Tail, separated with <sep>. The Head and the Tail events are short phrases possibly involving participants. The names of specific people have been replaced by generic words (e.g., PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ). PersonX is always the subject of the event. You have to determine whether the Head is located or can be found at/in/on the Tail or not. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No". The phrase may also contain "___", a placeholder that can be an object, a person, and/or an action.
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Physical Commonsense
Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example. The Head can be found at the Tail.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX achieves PersonY end<sep>Tail: to help PersonY
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, the Tail is not the location of the Head. So the output should be"No".
In this example, calculators can be found on the desktop. Thus, this example should be classified as "Yes".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX accepts the dare<sep>Tail: To know what the dare is
Negative Examples.explanation: In this example, the Tail is not the location of the Head. So the output should be "No".
In this example, the crabs can be found in the basket, and the output should be "Yes".

Instances.input: Head: PersonX achieves PersonX's potential<sep>Tail: gets rewards
Head: PersonX acknowledges gratefully the ___<sep>Tail: gives co-sign
Head: PersonX accidentally spilled ___<sep>Tail: to clean the mess
Head: PersonX accomplishes PersonX's purposes<sep>Tail: to finish projects
